problem.title: Problem Assumptions
problem.description: What problems do you assume exist and how painful are they?
prompts: The top problem customers face is...
This problem is urgent because...
Customers experience this problem when...
The current workarounds fail because...
The cost of not solving this is...
This problem affects [X]% of our target market...
The problem is getting worse because...
Customers are actively seeking solutions because...

existingAlternatives.title: Existing Alternatives Assumptions
existingAlternatives.description: What do you assume about how customers currently solve this?
prompts: Customers currently use [solution] to solve this...
The main alternatives cost approximately...
Existing solutions are inadequate because...
Competitors charge around [price] for...
The switching cost from alternatives is...
Current workarounds involve...
Market leaders in this space are...
Customers are dissatisfied with alternatives because...

customerSegments.title: Customer Segment Assumptions
customerSegments.description: Who do you believe experiences this problem most acutely?
prompts: Our primary customer segment is...

The decision maker is typically...

earlyAdopters.description: Who will try your solution first and why?

solution.description: What do you assume about how your solution will work?
